AddressBlockListComplianceModule.description: Block specific wallet addresses from accessing your asset. Prevents sanctioned or problematic addresses from participating.
AddressBlockListComplianceModule.title: Block addresses

CountryAllowListComplianceModule.description: Allow investors only from specific countries. Helps meet regional compliance requirements.
CountryAllowListComplianceModule.title: Country allowlist

CountryBlockListComplianceModule.description: Block investors from specific countries or regions. Helps comply with sanctions and regulatory restrictions.
CountryBlockListComplianceModule.title: Country blocklist

IdentityAllowListComplianceModule.description: Allow only verified identities from your approved list. Works well for exclusive offerings and private sales.
IdentityAllowListComplianceModule.title: Identity allowlist

IdentityBlockListComplianceModule.description: Block specific verified identities from accessing your asset. Remove problematic investors while staying compliant.
IdentityBlockListComplianceModule.title: Identity blocklist

SMARTIdentityVerificationComplianceModul.description: SMART identity verification makes sure only verified investors can hold or trade this token. It checks if an investor's digital identity contains the right claims such as "KYC passed", "accredited investor", or "not on sanctions list".
SMARTIdentityVerificationComplianceModul.shortDescription: SMART identity verification makes sure only verified investors can hold or trade this token
SMARTIdentityVerificationComplianceModul.title: SMART identity verification

helper.title: Identity verification rules
helper.intro: SMART identity verification makes sure only verified investors can hold or trade this token. It checks if an investor's digital identity contains the right claims such as "KYC passed", "accredited investor", or "not on sanctions list".
howToItems: Pick a claim topic (KYC, AML, accreditation, etc.).
Combine topics using logical operators: AND -> all must be true, OR -> at least one must be true, NOT -> exclude a condition.
Use groups to bundle parts of the rule for more advanced logic.

examples.micaStandard: MiCA / EU: (KYC AND AML) AND (PROFESSIONAL_INVESTOR OR ACCREDITED_INVESTOR)
examples.micaContract: MiCA / EU (allowing all contracts like tokens, vaults, ...): CONTRACT OR ((KYC AND AML) AND (PROFESSIONAL_INVESTOR OR ACCREDITED_INVESTOR))
